Issues.Title: One Time Binding
Issues.Body:
Add support for one time binding, such that once the binding has been evaluated and set, it does not take part in future refreshes of the component. 
This will be helpful in gaining some performance where we know that some of the data is not going to change during the life cycle of the component. For example some json content fetched from server which needs to be rendered in a table and we know this data will not change for very long time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "One Time Binding" (#816)

Issues.Title: Add support for sending arbitrary HttpContent, refs #479
Issues.Body: This adds support for sending arbitrary `HttpContent` by writing it to a `byte[]` first and then zero copy marshalling that as Uint8Array which is supported as request body.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add support for sending arbitrary HttpContent, refs #479 " (#815)

Issues.Title: Create a VSCode extension for the razor files used by Blazor.
Issues.Body: Most modern web developers use VS Code, which should provide a first class experience for developing Blazor applications, including IntelliSense for the Razor syntax and C# objects.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Create a VSCode extension for the razor files used by Blazor." (#814)

Issues.Title: ability to deserialize arrays through IDictionary<string, object>
Issues.Body:
Added ability for `JsonUtil.Deserialize<IDictionary<string, object>>(json)` to properly deserialize arrays to support a scenario where you want to deserialize json for which you don't know the schema at compile time.

fixes #812
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ability to deserialize arrays through IDictionary<string, object>" (#813)

Issues.Title: Unable to deserialize arrays via IDictionary<string, object>
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to deserialize arrays via IDictionary<string, object>" (#812)

Issues.Title: Blazor - Select drpdown list issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Blazor - Select drpdown list issue" (#811)

Issues.Title: Build MSB3073 error when I'm trying to ref some of my current netstandard library
Issues.Body:
Hi team,

I'm facing an Build MSB3073 error when I'm trying to ref some of [my current netstandard library](https://github.com/Swastika-IO/Swastika-IO-Core/blob/master/src/Swastika.Cms.Lib/Swastika.Cms.Lib.csproj). Could you help advise? Thanks.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build MSB3073 error when I'm trying to ref some of my current netstandard library" (#808)

Issues.Title: .cshtml does not accept 'string' for a 'object' type parameter
Issues.Body:
I've created a button with

```
[Parameter]
public object Content {get;set;}

<XButton Content="Click Me !" Clicked="@MyHandler" ref="_button"></XButton>
```

Visual studio does not recognize 'Content' value, 

Error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5623089/39875008-98d9ce6e-5499-11e8-8d70-a521ddbf7873.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".cshtml does not accept 'string' for a 'object' type parameter" (#810)

Issues.Title: html select with "multiple" attribute won't return the correct item in onchange event
Issues.Body:
With the following code
```
 <select name="cars" multiple onchange="@SelectionChanged">
        <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>
        <option value="saab">Saab</option>
        <option value="opel">Opel</option>
        <option value="audi">Audi</option>
    </select>
 void SelectionChanged(UIChangeEventArgs e)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(e.Value);
        }
```
Holding down the ctrl key, if you select 'volvo' first and then any other value, e.value is always 'volvo'. It basically returns the top selected item in the list.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "html select with "multiple" attribute won't return the correct item in onchange event" (#809)

Issues.Title: Browser Culture & other environment variables
Issues.Body:
It would be very useful to have informationon about the runtime environment, such as browser culture, in an Environment class. In particular the CurrentCulture might be set automatically to the browser culture, so that dates and numbers might be automatically displayed according to the Browser culture.
(I know this is easily achieved by calling some JavaScript environment filling function, but....)

It would be nice to have also information on the supported tags, so that "smart components" might automatically revert to widget when an Html5 input is not supported (Html5 input support is far from being complete on the mainstream browsers...also among the ones that support WebAssembly).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Browser Culture & other environment variables" (#807)

Issues.Title: The app display blank after upgrade Blazor version 0.3.0
Issues.Body:
Hi team,

My SPA app stops working and displays a blank page after upgrade to Blazor version 0.3.0. Could you help advise is there any configuration or additional migration steps required for upgrade to v0.3.0?

Repo: https://github.com/Swastika-IO/Swastika-IO-Admin-Blazor

Thanks.
Huy
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The app display blank after upgrade Blazor version 0.3.0" (#804)

Issues.Title: Quick information needed in the current release can we create the component using C# code, Without creating using .cshtml file and use it as component
Issues.Body:
I i tried to create component by creating only the C# class inheriting from Component class, but i am getting below error. i do not have any valid use case of this. 

``` csharp
WASM: * Assertion at /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/test-mono-mainline-webassembly/label/highsierra/mono/metadata/loader.c:2468, condition `mono_metadata_token_table (m->token) == MONO_TABLE_METHOD' not met
MonoPlatform.ts:191:25
WASM: 
MonoPlatform.ts:191:25
uncaught exception: abort(). Build with -s ASSERTIONS=1 for more info.

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Quick information needed in the current release can we create the component using C# code, Without creating using .cshtml file and use it as component" (#806)

Issues.Title: Bind multiple values from input box
Issues.Body:
I have a multiple select input box 

```
<select multiple="multiple" bind=state.states>
  <option value="AL">Alabama</option>
  <option value="WY">Wyoming</option>
  <option value="WY">Washington</option>
</select>
```

I like to access the value selected via state.states but I am getting empty here. What is the right way to do this. Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bind multiple values from input box " (#805)

Issues.Title: Loading issue when built with dotnet core 2.1 RC
Issues.Body:
Since I have updated to dotnet core 2.1 RC released yesterday, I am no able to run the blazor app I build and run.

Is there some known issues?

Issues.Title: Running into an assertion: mono/utils/memfuncs.c:152, condition `unaligned_bytes (src) == 0' not met
Issues.Body:
I have a little prototype where I try to disassemble .NET assemblies in the browser with Mono.

The code is here: https://github.com/discostu105/bilspy

However; I am running into a Mono assertation. Not sure if this is a blazor / mono / webassembly bug, or my own.

Error: 
```
WASM: * Assertion at /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/test-mono-mainline-webassembly/label/highsierra/mono/utils/memfuncs.c:152, 
condition `unaligned_bytes (src) == 0' not met MonoPlatform.ts:191 
WASM: mono.js:1 Uncaught abort(). Build with -s ASSERTIONS=1 for more info.`
```
Screenshot of the problem (from Chrome devtools): https://twitter.com/discostu105/status/992663078981525504

How to reproduce:
 * Build and Run https://github.com/discostu105/bilspy (it's blazor 0.3)
 * "Choose File": `C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\Accessibility.dll` (it does not really matter which assembly exactly, but there are a couple of different errors for different assemblies).
 * In F12 dev tools you should see the error mentioned.

Again, I am not totally sure this isn't my error, but I am kind of stuck with that kind of error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Running into an assertion: mono/utils/memfuncs.c:152, condition `unaligned_bytes (src) == 0' not met" (#800)

Issues.Title: Fix #745 - allow multiple implements directives
Issues.Body:
The pass for this was 'break'ing after the first directive for no real
reason. Oops.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix #745 - allow multiple implements directives" (#797)

Issues.Title: Add tests for #773
Issues.Body:
This doesn't seem to repro anymore after fixing #772. Adding tests
anyway.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add tests for #773" (#796)

Issues.Title: Fix 773
Issues.Body:
We weren't handling a few cases that can occur during typing correctly.
Our passes that look at the content of attributes need to be prepared
for it to be empty in cases where the attribute has been partially
typed in the editor.

I added a smoke test for this that attempts to simulate typing and found
another issue to fix.

The end result of this is that the design for this kind of code is
simpler and takes a more 'brute-force' approach to understanding
attributes. I think this is a good change based on the problems with how
this code has been written today, there are too many possible cases to
try and have the code express and document them all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix 773" (#795)

Issues.Title: Proposal: Optimize render tree build & diff with lazy RenderFragments
Issues.Body:
# Summary I noticed that components that produce a lot of HTML elements tend to become noticeably slow. You can observe this on the linked page if you click on the button at the bottom a few times : https://unicode-browser.azurewebsites.net/blocks/CJK%20Unified%20Ideographs What you should observe is that at some point, even the spinner takes time to appear. (Likely because Blazor is re-rendering the whole table for each small update) # Rationale Today, it seems we are able to separate updates of the DOM by enclosing parts of the application in a component. However, splitting a page in many small components only for the purpose of rendering optimization tends to be very tedious, and maybe not doable at all in some cases. The idea here is to provide a way for avoiding to re-render semi-static content everytime the ````BuildRenderTree```` is called. # Proposal I propose that Blazor would provide a mechanism in-between ````RenderFragment```` and ````BlazorComponent````. Let's say that we provide to ````RenderTreeBuilder```` a ````RenderFragment```` that is tagged with a **unique** string ID (e.g. a GUID string in some cases). The API could look like this: ````csharp class RenderTreeBuilder { // â¦ public void AddLazyContent(int sequence, string id, RenderFragment fragment) { /* â¦ */ } // â¦ } ```` The idea is that you generate a unique ID so as to let the render tree diff builder to identify your specific fragment (and detect addition/removal of said fragment), but the lazy fragment is only rendered once, when it is newly added in the render tree. (NB: It may be rendered subsequently if it is removed, then added back later) ## Caveats Developers would have to stay aware that the lazy content will be evaluated outside of the ````BuildRenderTree```` method (hence its lazyness), and remember to be careful about closures. However, it might not be that different from ````RenderFragments```` generated outside of the ````BuildRenderTree```` method. ## Advantages ### For Razor codegen Code generation for cshtml could take advantage of this in cases like these: ````html @foreach (var item in Items) { }
Foo Bar
@item.Foo@item.Bar
```` There, the codegen could determine that ````table > thead````, unlike ````table > tbody````, is purely static content and generate a lazy fragment (with a statically generated string ID) that would span the whole ````thead```` tag and would only be evaluated once. Thus, when the developer requests the page to refresh, the whole markup for the table header wouldn't have to be re-generated, and only the parts related to the dynamically-generated ````tbody```` would be rebuilt. (That obviously includes the enclosing ````table```` element, which contains the ````tbody````, itself containing the dynamic content) ### For manually generated components Developers could use lazy content for parts of the document that are dynamic, at their own risk, thus avoiding the cost of rebuilding the whole render tree when they only need to update a small part of a document. ## Going furher ### For manually generated components It might be even better if lazy fragments could be forcefully re-rendered, thus blurring the lines with components even more. I am not sure how this would be best achieved, however. Maybe by calling a method based on the string ID ? ### For components It would be great if there was a way to indicate that an element should be treated as lazy, even tough it contains fragments of C#. (Maybe something like a ````blazor-lazy```` attribute ?) This would allow more flexibility in the design of pages/components, without having to resort to manually built render trees.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Proposal: Optimize render tree build & diff with lazy RenderFragments" (#788)

Issues.Title: Circularly dependent layouts cause lockups
Issues.Body:
Layouts that are circularly dependent are not handled gracefully and instead causes a browser lockup.

### Example 1
**SomeLayout**
```
@inherits BlazorLayoutComponent
@layout SomeLayout
```

### Example 2
**LayoutA**
```
@inherits BlazorLayoutComponent
@layout LayoutB
```

**LayoutB**
```
@inherits BlazorLayoutComponent
@layout LayoutA
```

### Example 3
**SomeLayout**
```
@inherits BlazorLayoutComponent
```

**_ViewImports**
```
@layout SomeLayout
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Circularly dependent layouts cause lockups" (#793)

Issues.Title: Adding event-handler in .cshtml crashes Visual studio
Issues.Body: I am using latest CI builds. when you try to type event-handler for any event in .cshtml, VS crashes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adding event-handler in .cshtml crashes Visual studio " (#794)

Issues.Title: convert marshalled members to camelCase
Issues.Body:
Convert the member names to camelCase for interfaces/class/types getting marshalled to C# side.


As @SteveSandersonMS asked in https://github.com/aspnet/Blazor/issues/774


I've  coordinated with @galvesribiero and he is updating his PR: https://github.com/aspnet/Blazor/pull/771
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "convert marshalled members to camelCase" (#792)

Issues.Title: Parent-Childs hierarchy
Issues.Body:
The idea is, I want to build the hierarchy after rendering. The component will know and easy to access its parent and child component by using Parent and Childrens property.

Is there a way to achieve this?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Parent-Childs hierarchy" (#790)

Issues.Body:
when I test use IE11 , it is not work,  show "promise" undefined.
can you help me? or how to fix this bug
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "it is not work in IE11 or FireFox59.0.3" (#789)

Issues.Title: Simple autorebuild mechanism for hosted apps
Issues.Body:
In the 0.3.0 release we had to disable autorebuild for hosted apps due to a bug. This PR re-enables it, replacing the implementation with a much simpler alternative.

This implementation should be understood as a stopgap measure until some future version of ASP.NET Core and VS can hopefully extend the native autorebuild support to rebuild when there are changes in referenced projects. Once (and if) that is implemented, both the standalone and hosted variants of Blazor's autorebuild feature could be removed because both would inherit it from ASP.NET Core.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Simple autorebuild mechanism for hosted apps" (#787)
